More Notes: Cumulative TFP loss since 1961 due to anthropogenic climate change.
Cumulative TFP loss since 1961 due to anthropogenic climate change in warmer regions.
Indicates the number of years of productivity growth lost due to ACC
This value represents the reduction in Total Factor Productivity due to ACC, discussed as more severe than when adjustments for inputs are included.
This is the mean impact of ACC on Total Factor Productivity from 1961 to a baseline year, with standard deviation.
Specific value highlighting regional disparity in Total Factor Productivity impact due to ACC.
Region-specific impact of Total Factor Productivity due to ACC.
Region-specific impact of Total Factor Productivity due to ACC.
Region-specific impact of Total Factor Productivity due to ACC, showing less impact relative to warmer regions.
Region-specific impact of Total Factor Productivity due to ACC, showing even less impact.
Cumulative TFP loss since 1961. The text mentions the impact is a detectable and sizeable impact as of 2020.

Average mean impact; this appears to be a time-averaged cumulative impact since 1961, though is not fully specified. Uncertainty estimates are based on climate, econometric, and specification uncertainties.
Average mean impact of 288 models that do not exclude observations.
